title: What was the greatest invention of the 1900s? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nuclear weapons. There have been no other weapons which can deliver such a scale of destruction in a matter of seconds. Not to forget the horrid after-effects which continue to torment generations upon generations of those who might have been exposed to the radiation. All of this was possible because of the discovery of quantum nature of reality. Harnessing the power of the atom to destabilise entire nations and prevent war from ever happening again on a large scale. The MAD doctrine which has emerged from the power of nukes has proven to take advantage of humans’ most inherent tendency of self-preservation. No nation will dare attack any other nation with nuclear weapons. It is due to nukes that now nations are more willing to war on the economic front. They are more willing to invest in soft power. Very ironic indeed, as someone has said (don’t know who), that the worst weapons forge the greatest peace. Amazing.  I am Arjun, by the way. I write when I don’t have much else to do.

I would have to say it’s a toss up between the microchip and the internet. They both revolutionised everything, making life better for pretty much everyone. And yes, they both have their downsides, but if you go back to the 40s, and look at the way things were done then, it’s no contest.
1900, meaning 1900–1910? The airplane Kittyhawk by the Wright Brothers.

My first idea was Cinema. First we in industrialized nation’s can hardly imagine, how great was the influence of cinema in less alphabetized countries , e g. India or ‘Southern Italy’. On other big step were the computer before 1970, which enabled much more centralisation.
